articles.summary: Morphe, a popular UK beauty brand, has abruptly closed all seven standalone stores it operated from across the country, leaving staff with no notice and leaving 73 staff members without a job. The decision aligns with Forma Brands' strategy to prioritise and expand its wholesale and e-commerce operations, similar to our model in the U.S. The closure has led to an ownership transition of the UK wholesale and online businesses, which will operate as FORMA BRANDS UK LTD. In recognition of the employees' dedication, Forma Brand has provided goodwill payments to all affected employees, equivalent to an enhanced redundancy package.

Taking to ... [1997 symbols]
articles.summary: A swimming fan has criticised Aussie pool queen Ariarne Titmus' yellow fingernails at the Paris Games for suggesting that she has an unfair advantage over her competitors due to her painted nails. The fan took to American social news website reddit to express his concerns about the legality of the practice. While some fans were mixed, others felt that Titmus was given preferential treatment due to the colouring of her nails. There is no rule in place which bans athletes from entering the water with their nails done, nor is there supposed to be a rule against athletes from competing with such nails. While Titmus has been well-received for her performance in the pool, she recently faced criticism for criticising the 'ridiculous' conditions inside the Olympic village.

Fraley had made her financial plight public via a post on social media stating that she couldn't afford her rent due to school sending only 75% of her rent compared to what it pays for football players without a win. Ohanian responded by sending payment out $7,760. The payment was split between the businessman and husband of Serena Williams. Despite the differences in Olympic earnings depending on the medals earned, Team USA pays $37,500 for a gold medal, $22,500, and $15,000 for a bronze medal.

articles.summary: The NBC series Suits: LA, a spin-off of the USA Network series, is set to begin production in Los Angeles after filming the pilot episode in Vancouver. The series, which will be set in the same universe as the original Suits, will feature all new characters and stories, though it is possible for former Suits stars to make a cameo appearance. The show, which stars Stephen Amell as lawyer Ted Black, follows Black as a former New York lawyer who has reinvented himself in LA and finds himself representing the most powerful clients in Los Los Angeles. The cast includes Josh McDermitt as Stuart Lane, Lex Scott Davis as Erica Rollins, and Bryan Greenberg as Rick Dodsen. There is no indication when the series may debut on NBC.

The incident sparked a global backlash, led by Italy's Prime Minister and Harry Potter author JK Rowling, who joined Giorgia Meloni in condemning the match. The fight ended after Carini was hit so hard that she 'couldn't breathe' and claimed she was unable to continue. The Italian prime minister, joined by former British Prime Minister Liz Truss and Sir Andy Murray's mother, Judy, and female sports stars, called the match 'unfair' and 'a travesty' for men who control power over women.

articles.summary: Ford Motor Company (NYSE: F) is one of the most iconic automakers in the history of the industry, but its stock price has only declined by 36%. Despite this, Ford's valuable dividend is family-backed, boosted by special dividends, and a long-term wealth generator. The company's total value returned by excluding dividends is stark compared to the total stock price gains alone. The $0.15 quarterly dividend provides a 5.36% yield, and investors can count on numerous supplemental dividends over time. Despite challenges in China and the development of its electric vehicle division, Ford Motor Company's high-yield, wealth-generating dividend remains a key reason for owning shares.

articles.summary: Amber Rutter, a Great Britain athlete, will be competing in the Olympics in skeet shooting just three months after becoming a mother, following a successful pregnancy. Rutter and her husband, James, had planned to have children but the timing of Tommy's arrival with the Games looming as close as possible could not have been better timing. She had to choose between continuing to try for a baby or competing in an Olympics. Despite her decision to interrupt training due to pregnancy, Rutter had to make informed choices about her training schedule due to the nature of her sport and lack of medical research about how noise and recoil can affect the baby's development. Her son was born healthy and healthy.

She also revealed that someone had previously broken into her property and sprayed a corrosive substance over her Range Rover. The property is currently in need of some repairs, with photos showing damage to its outside walls and marks in the kitchen from where cupboards have been pulled out.

articles.title: Erlestoke prisoners escape jail routine by digging for pottery
articles.description: The archaeological digs were part of rehabilitation for the prisoners serving at HMP Erlestoke.
articles.content: A group of inmates have unearthed Roman pottery in a Wiltshire prison as part of an archaeology project. Inmates at HMP Erlestoke have been working on the scheme run by Wessex Archaeology overseen by ... [2289 symbols]
articles.summary: Inmates from HMP Erlestoke in Wiltshire have unearthed Roman pottery in a prison as part of an archaeology project. The scheme, run by Wessex Archaeology, was overseen by Phil Harding, former Time Team presenter. The BBC was given exclusive access to the dig and spoke to two of the prisoners, both serving long sentences for violent crimes. The project was funded by the National Lottery’s Heritage Fund and was the idea of Wessex archaeology. It is hoped that this initiative will help offenders re-offend after being released, as over a third of prisoners re-enter society with criminal activities.

Despite having assets of £585,633 and owing creditors £583,748, the company is only just staying in the black. The brand, which sells exotic candles and perfume, has been compared to Goop. Despite not being financially flourishing, accounts filed in October 2023 showed it had just £149 in assets. Willoughy's own lifestyle brand launched in 2021 and currently sells candles, style advice, and a section on spirituality where readers are advised on crystals, healing and auras. She almost launched a lifestyle website with former pal, Dragon's Den star Peter Jones, in 2018 with Holly as its face.

articles.title: Brit tourist arrested in Greece after partner was killed in car crash

Greek police have arrested a British man on manslaughter charges after his partner was killed in a brutal head-on car crash in Greece earlier this week.

The 28-year-old Brit was behind the wheel with... [2522 symbols]
articles.summary: Greek police have arrested a 28-year-old British man on manslaughter charges after his partner was killed in a head-on car crash in Greece. The car was driven by the 28, British man and his 33-year partner, who veered into oncoming traffic and collided with a second car driven by a 42-year Albanian man. Both drivers escaped with minor injuries, but the 33 year old woman sustained critical trauma and was rushed to Kos hospital with serious head trauma. She died hours later, with doctors unable to save her. The arrest comes after a British woman was run down and dragged along the tarmac by a reckless driver on the Greek island of Crete.

articles.title: Millions ditch Windows 10 ahead of Microsoft deadline, are you ready to switch?
articles.description: Millions of Windows 10 users are finally ditching this popular operating system ahead of Microsoft's end of support next year.
articles.content: There's just over a year until Microsoft scraps support for its hugely popular Windows 10 operating system and it appears that the looming deadline is starting to have an impact on user numbers. Lates... [2838 symbols]
articles.summary: There is just over a year before Microsoft ends support for its Windows 10 operating system, due to a deadline set for October 2025. This is affecting user numbers, with Windows 10 now having a 64 percent share of the market compared to Windows 11's 30 percent mark. Meanwhile, Windows 11 now has a 31 percent share, surpassing Windows 10's 26 percent share in the spring. Microsoft's support will continue for those willing to pay a fee at $61 per year. The Extended Security Update (ESU) programme will be available until 2028. If you cannot afford this, Microsoft will offer Extended Security Updates to allow for additional time to upgrade Windows 10. Other options include keeping Windows 10 on a current PC and upgrading to Windows 10 via Microsoft's software update or buying a new laptop with this latest OS already installed.

articles.title: Trump's deportation plan would cut labor workforce by nearly half
articles.description: Nearly half of agricultural workers in the U.S. are undocumented immigrants, prompting warnings that Trump's mass deportation plan would create major obstacles for farmers.
articles.content:
Former President Donald Trump's mass deportation plan could cut half of the agricultural labor force if enacted and severely cripple America's dairy industry, experts have warned.

Nearly half of agri... [3227 symbols]

keywords.name: Former President Donald Trumps mass deportation plan

articles.summary: Former President Donald Trump's plan to deport all migrants unlawfully in the U.S. could result in a reduction in the agricultural labor force and severely impact America's dairy industry. Nearly half of agricultural workers in the US are undocumented immigrants, and 45 percent of all agricultural workers are "unauthorized" migrants working illegally on American farms and ranches. Immigrant labor accounts for 51% of all dairy labor, and dairies that employ immigrant labor produce 79% of the US milk supply. This could significantly impact the dairy industry in Wisconsin and California, particularly as 70% of labor on Wisconsin's dairy farms is carried out by over 10,000 undocumented migrant workers. The deportation policy could sway voters toward Vice President Kamala Harris, who would beat Trump in Wisconsin by two points.

articles.title: Kurram clashes: How a Pakistani land dispute led to a deadly tribal battle
articles.description: At least 46 people were killed and 200 injured in clashes until a ceasefire was agreed upon on Wednesday.
articles.content:
At least 46 people were killed and 200 injured in clashes until a temporary ceasefire was agreed upon on Wednesday.

Islamabad, Pakistan – After weeklong clashes between rival tribes in Pakistan’s dis... [7746 symbols]
articles.summary: After a week of clashes between rival tribes in Pakistan's district of Kurram, which resulted in at least 46 deaths and injuries of nearly 200, has now been halted following a meeting between authorities and tribal elders. The meeting included tribal elders, civilian and security officials, and a temporary ceasefire was agreed upon. No casualties have been reported since then and the government is confident of resolving the conflict. The conflict began over a land dispute between Shia-majority and Sunni-majority tribes, which has led to fighting in the past. The Human Rights Commission of Pakistan has urged the government to broker peace in the area, stating that all disputes over land or sectarian conflict must be resolved peacefully through negotiations convened by the KP government.

articles.summary: A 20m mural in Birmingham's Southside District has been created by local artist Melita Berg to highlight the need for services and support for domestic abuse victims. The mural, which took two weeks to create, is wrapped around the former Oceana nightclub on the corner of Hurst Street and Smallbrook Queensway. Berg expressed her appreciation for the project, noting that abuse is often done in secret and could lead to someone hiding their pain.

articles.summary: A small alligator was found underneath a car in Donora, Pennsylvania, and taken to the Wild World of Animals. The Salvation Army helped catch the alligator and police took it to the animal sanctuary outside Bentleyville. This comes after two men connected to several alligator sightings along the Kiski River were ordered to pay fines after pleading guilty to violating rules and regulations related to the transportation and sale of fish. The fines were imposed following multiple sightings of alligators in Kiskic Township over the past several months. The Humane Agents seized 10 gators from one of the men's homes due to safety concerns for the animals.

articles.title: Another hot day for UK with 30C temperatures ahead of warm weekend
articles.description: Britain will experience another hot day today with temperatures soaring to 30C (86F) once again after almost a month's worth of rain fell in an hour in London last night.
articles.content:
Britain will experience another hot day today with temperatures soaring to 30C (86F) once again after almost a month's worth of rain fell in an hour last night.

This weekend is also set to be sunny a... [8319 symbols]
articles.summary: UK temperatures are expected to reach 30C (86F) today, with temperatures expected to rise to around 25C (77F) across many parts of the UK, with slightly lower highs expected to continue rising into next week. This comes after almost a month's worth of rain fell in an hour last night, with New Addington in South London seeing the heaviest downpour of 53mm (2.1in) of rain, the equivalent rainfall for the month of August in the same area. The Environment Agency has issued 26 flood alerts across England this morning, including 11 in the outskirts of Greater London. Met Office meteorologist Alex Burkill said that while there will still be some heavy showers across the far East of England at first, these will largely clear before more showers develop across eastern England into the afternoon, along with thunder. However, he warned that a system moving in from the North West could bring increasing cloud and outbreaks of rain which could be heavy across parts of Scotland, Northern Ireland and the far North and West of England and Wales.

articles.title: Dear Abby: Dad cut me out of his life when I suggested family therapy. Now the whole family won’t talk to me
articles.description: He told siblings and other relatives I cut off all contact.
articles.content: DEAR ABBY: After several years of worsening arguments, I told my father I was tired of fighting with him, and we needed family counseling. He was deeply, explosively offended and not only refused to t... [1892 symbols]
articles.summary: After several years of arguing with my father, who was deeply offended when he suggested family therapy, after I suggested that the two should have family counseling. His response was met with hostility and he stopped all contact with me and changed his will. He then called my siblings and told them he was disowned and disowned. This has led to a decrease in contact with my family, including my aunts and cousins who no longer invite me to family events. The relationship with my dad is probably not likely to repairable, but he has told all of his extended family that I was the one who cut off contact with him and started it. What can you do besides sending out a mass email blast explaining the situation?

articles.summary: The rapid and ongoing adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) technology has been a key driver of the market rebound, with some high-profile names losing ground recently. However, recent developments have seen some high profile names losing their share due to the slow adoption of AI technology. This gives savvy investors an opportunity to invest in companies that still have room to grow in the AI market. Among the notable names are Palantir Technologies (NYSE: PLTR), which has a long history of developing AI tools for the U.S. government and its allies and expanded its mandate to help businesses discover actionable intelligence from corporate data, and Palantar's Artificial Intelligence Platform (AIP), which helps provide common sense solutions to everyday business problems. Despite this, most experts believe that we're still in the early stages of AI adoption. Meanwhile, Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI), also known as Supermicro, could see significant growth as a result of its high-end server manufacturer. The company's revenue surged 200% year over year to roughly $3.8 billion and its diluted earnings per share soared 329% to $6.56.

articles.title: Union leaders push Starmer to ease strike rules and reduce worker hours
articles.description: Boardrooms are currently awaiting the Government's incoming Employment Bill, which is expected to award workers full rights from day one.
articles.content: Unions are urging Sir Keir Starmer to cut workers’ hours and make strikes easier. British employment laws are “significantly weaker” than those in other major economies, research for the Trades Union ... [1953 symbols]
articles.summary: Unions are urging UK Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer to reduce worker hours and make strikes easier. Research by the Trades Union Congress (TUC) has found that British employment laws are significantly weaker than those in other major economies, according to the TUC. The study also revealed that labour laws were half as protective as those in France and significantly weaker as Spain, Italy, and Germany. The TUC's general secretary, Paul Nowak, called for the Government's Employment Rights Bill within the first 100 days of the term. The proposed measures include increasing the minimum wage and banning “fire and rehire” practices. However, concerns have been raised about an increase in unfair dismissal complaints and a system that mirrors the strict labour laws in France.

articles.summary: Venezuela's opposition leader, Maria Corina Machado, has called for mass protests over the disputed re-election of President Nicolas Maduro, who was announced as the winner of the country's presidential election on Sunday. This decision has sparked political crisis in Venezuela, with Maduro's victory exceeding pre-election polls and drawing global criticism. Machado maintains her claim that opposition candidate Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia was the rightful winner, based on tallies obtained from most of the nation's polling stations. The government-aligned National Electoral Council declared that Maduro won with 51% of the vote. The United States and the European Union have demanded Venezuelan authorities release detailed voting data. At least 20 people have died in protests after the election, while over 1,000 have been jailed. Venezuela has also withdrawn diplomats from eight critical Latin American countries and asked envoys from those nations to leave its territory.

articles.summary: Warren Buffett, CEO of Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK.A) and the largest equity holding in the company's portfolio is Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL). The company's cash and cash equivalents balance, which Buffett invests almost all of it in short-term Treasury bonds, is expected to exceed $200 billion in value when Berkshire reports its second-quarter earnings. This comes as Buffett has sold more equities than he bought for six consecutive quarters, including two consecutive quarters of selling Apple shares. This could make it eight quarters in a row. Berkshire Hathway's Treasury holdings have grown from $109 billion in 2022 to $189 billion 18 months later. Despite this, Buffett has warned that the Treasury holdings are probably overkill and suggests it's increasingly difficult to find a good investment opportunity regardless of the size of your portfolio.

Japan's Nikkei index fell 5.8% and the broader Japanese Topix fell 6.1%, Australia's ASX fell 2.5%, and Hong Kong's Hang Seng was down 2.2%. This follows a sharp drop in the small-cap Russell 2000 index and chip designer Nvidia's slump from record highs. Analysts from Deutsche Bank highlighted weak earnings from Amazon and suggested that investors are betting that the Federal Reserve will intervene to boost economic growth. Intel, the US chip manufacturer, reported unexpectedly weak earnings and plans to cut 15% of its workforce, potentially resulting in a loss of over 17,500 jobs globally.

articles.summary: Angels star Mike Trout, a three-time MVP and 11-time All-Star, has been ruled out for the rest of the MLB season due to a second surgery for a torn meniscus in his left knee. This comes after a previous surgery in May to repair the meniscon, and Trout had been working towards a return before his rehab was shut down. Despite batting.220 with 10 homers and 14 RBIs in 29 games for the Angels this season, Trout has been limited by a series of injuries over the past four years. He hasn't played more than 119 games in any of the past five seasons. Trout is making $37.1m in the sixth year of a 12-year, $426.5m contract and will earn that salary in each of the next six seasons.

articles.title: Weather tracker: Record-breaking rain in Delhi leaves trail of destruction
articles.description: Almost 200 killed as deluge sweeps northern India, while showers give way to high humidity at Paris Olympics
articles.content: Between Wednesday and Thursday morning, 147mm of rain was recorded in eastern parts of Delhi and its suburbs by the India Meteorological Department (IMD), breaking a 14-year record for the highest sin... [1987 symbols]
articles.summary: Record-breaking rainfall in Delhi and its suburbs has left a trail of destruction, with over half of the city receiving over half its monthly rainfall. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) reported 147mm of rain, breaking a 14-year record for the highest single day total in July. This caused infrastructure damage in northern India as widespread waterlogging led to flash floods. In Kerala, landslides were triggered, with an estimated 572mm of rainfall falling in 48 hours. At least 194 people have been killed and over 8,300 people are relocated to government-run relief camps. The IMD has issued weather warnings for the remainder of this week for isolated and extremely heavy rain, their highest rainfall threshold. Some schools and offices will remain closed due to the potential for further flooding. The Paris Olympics have seen temperatures rise, affecting spectators and athletes, and some sports have had to change their rules to ensure safety.

This transaction involved the sale of 19,216,833 shares at a price of $40.52 each. Following this sale, Berkshire Hathaway still holds a significant 11.54% position in its portfolio, down from 12.15%. This move could signal a strategic shift or rebalancing of Berkshire's vast portfolio, which remains heavily invested in major corporations across various sectors. The financial sector continues to be a significant component of the global economy and its performance is seen as a bellwether for broader economic conditions. Despite this, the recent sale by Buffett could potentially cause short-term volatility in BAC's stock price.

This comes after severe rainfall across North Korea's western provinces caused severe flooding and left thousands of citizens stranded. No casualty figures have been released, but 4,200 residents were reportedly evacuated by the North Korea Air Force. articles.content: MONTGOMERY, Ala. — A former corrections officer at an Alabama jail has agreed to plead guilty to a criminal charge in the death of a mentally ill man who died of hypothermia after being held naked in ... [2640 symbols]
articles.summary: Former corrections officer at an Alabama jail, Joshua Conner Jones, has agreed to plead guilty to a criminal charge related to the death of Tony Mitchell, a mentally ill man who died of hypothermia after being held naked in a concrete cell for two weeks. Jones entered into a plea agreement with prosecutors regarding the treatment of two inmates at the Walker County jail. He also pleaded guilty to another rights-deprivation count related to assault of another inmate. The plea agreement indicated there were five co-conspirators involved in the mistreatment of Mitchell, indicating that the investigation is ongoing and more people could be charged in the death. Mitchell died on Jan. 26, 2023, after being brought from the jail to a hospital emergency room with a body temperature of 72 degrees.

articles.title: There's Really Only 1 Surefire Way To Know If You're Eating Enough Protein
articles.description: Remember this the next time a social media influencer promotes a protein-packed meal.
articles.content: Just how much protein you need will vary depending on your gender, size, age and how much you exercise, experts say. But “we don’t need as much protein as many people believe” to maintain muscle tissu... [1685 symbols]
articles.summary: The amount of protein you need depends on your age, size, age, and how much exercise is required to maintain muscle tissue, according to experts. However, "we don’t need as much protein as many people believe," according to registered dietician Braeden Yacobucci, a dietician at OnPoint Nutrition in Philadelphia. Yacobinucci noted that 65 grams of protein per day is roughly 10 ounces of animal protein, compared to approximately 10 ounces per day for a chicken thigh. Doctor-ordered tests can confirm if you are eating enough protein. Early protein deficiency symptoms include fatigue, weakened immune system, fatigue, and a decreased sleep-deprivedness. Additionally, fiber could also be a factor, as well as not getting enough fiber.

articles.title: The 1 Thing You Should Never, Ever Do If Your Car Is Hydroplaning
articles.description: It might be a natural reaction, but this maneuver will make a dangerous situation even worse.
articles.content: “It’s like being a boat. Your tires are completely not in contact with the asphalt,” explained Mike Thomas, a driving instructor for 27 years and co-founder of AllGood Driving School in Northern Calif... [1491 symbols]
articles.summary: The one thing to avoid from hydroplaning is to panic and stop your car from re-establish traction, according to Mike Thomas, a driving instructor for 27 years and co-founder of AllGood Driving School in Northern California. This position is described as "like being a boat," as the tires are completely not in contact with the asphalt and the car's position is dependent on the position it takes. There is little to do until the tires regain traction, so avoid being in this position. The most common mistake is to slam the brakes, which can cause the car to lurch to the left or right. There are several steps to reduce hydroplans, including extra caution in the beginning of storms and slow down in flood conditions.

entities.data: the European Convention on Human Rights

articles.summary: New law, part of the Victims and Prisoners Act, prevents the most heinous criminals from enjoying important life events they took from their victims. The law applies to killers who are serving whole-life orders, such as Wayne Couzens and Lucy Letby. In 2008, serial killer Levi Bellfield was convicted of the murders of 19-year-old Marsha McDonnell and 22, and the attempted murder of 18-year old Kate Sheedy. Prior to the new law, prisoners could apply for marriage or a civil partnership, but this could only be refused by a prison governor due to security concerns. The Lord Chancellor will retain the right to permit ceremonies in exceptional circumstances.

articles.summary: The aftermath of college protests, which resulted in thousands of arrests this spring, has impacted students' academic careers. Some 3,200 people were arrested during a wave of pro-Palestinian tent encampments protesting the war in Gaza. While many have already seen their charges dismissed, cases have yet to be resolved for hundreds of people at campuses with the highest number of arrests. In St. Louis, Valencia Alvarez is awaiting potential charges for a protest at Washington University, where 23 of the arrested students were students. The University of New York at New Paltz has asked judges to dismiss 129 cases stemming from arrests at the State University New York. Students have criticized college leaders' decisions to invite police into their gates, claiming they trampled peaceful demonstrations with unnecessary levels of force.

However, the film underdelivers on its promise by introducing several new characters, including Sandy's entire family, who are one-note and are stereotypical Southern archetypes instead of fleshed-out characters. The animation style for the movie was criticized for being overly smooth and unhelpful. The film's animation was criticized by some for blending live action with live-action worlds, and it all takes a few minutes to adjust to the medium.

articles.summary: The United Nations (UN) has called for the deployment of international security forces in Haiti to be accelerated following a report by the UN that revealed that at least 1,379 people were killed or wounded in gang warfare and 428 people were kidnapped between April and June this year. The report also warned of an average of 40 rape victims a day in some areas of the capital. Armed gangs have controlled most of the Haitian capital since former president Jovenel Moïse was assassinated in 2021. The UN's office in Port-au-Prince reported that while casualties have decreased in recent months, recruitment of children and sexual violence is increasing. The Haitian prime minister, Garry Conille, has pledged to use the 400 Kenyan police officers to retake control of the country "house by house".

articles.summary: Chinese tourist airship, AS700, has successfully completed a two-hour test flight in Hubei province, aiming to serve in the low-altitude tourism sector. The AS700 flew above tourist attractions at a speed of 60km/h and an altitude of 500 metres (1,640 feet) for about two hours. Its manufacturer, the state-owned Aviation Industry Corporation of China (Avic), said the speed and flight altitude allowed tourists to enjoy a high level of stability and security. The airship can travel uninterrupted for 10 hours and can hold up to nine passengers to reach its maximum 700km range and flight time. It is also expected to be used in logistics, intelligent topography, emergency rescue, anti-terrorism tasks and security control. Avic has had 20 orders for the airship from domestic travel agencies and tourist attractions, with the first aircraft set to be delivered by the end of the year.

Proms controller Sam Jackson assured that the act will be "entirely appropriate". Sam has also promised not to show up wearing a thong and has stated that he loves the proms and doesn't intend to remove his clothes from them.

The report also revealed that Match of the Day presenter Gary Lineker topped the list with a salary of between £1,350,000 and £1.354,999. Clare Balding, who first joined the BBC in 1994, is now one of the biggest names in BBC's sports coverage and is a regular on the BBC Sports Personality of the Year. Her net worth is estimated to be around £1 million, partly due to her work with the BBC.

articles.description: Five factors Kyiv needs to defeat Vladimir Putin – and to do so decisively – rather than just survive
articles.content:
Despite more than two years of war – and hundreds of thousands of casualties – Western leaders remain divided on what they want Kyiv to achieve.

Many seek Ukraine’s survival in some form as a soverei... [1075 symbols]
articles.summary: Despite over two years of war, and hundreds of thousands of casualties, Western leaders are divided on what they want Ukraine to achieve. Many believe Ukraine should aim for survival as a sovereign nation, while others argue for Russia's defeat. This has led to a mixed policy of arming Ukraine with enough to survive but not enough to win. As things stand, a protracted stalemate or defeat seems the most likely outcome. Francis Dearnley, The Telegraph's assistant comment editor and co-presenter of Ukraine: The Latest, analyses five factors that could transform Ukraine's fortunes.

The cancellation ... [2103 symbols]

articles.summary: The Labour government has cancelled a planned £800 million supercomputer, or exascale, that would have been 50 times more powerful than any other computer in the UK. The decision is part of a £1.3 billion funding cut, which will also see a £500 million AI project withdrawn. Chancellor Rachel Reeves warned that the previous government's economic situation was worse than expected, as the government prioritises election pledges such as a deal with striking junior doctors. The supercomputer would be based in Edinburgh and was hoped to help scientists speed up research in important areas such as medicines and nuclear fusion. The move comes as the current Secretary of State Peter Kyle has announced that the Department for Science, Innovation and Technology (DSIT) has not budgeted for the project.

articles.summary: Olympic swimmer Tom Dean has been announced as the first official contestant for Strictly Come Dancing, breaking the show's rules by announcing himself on chat shows and radio shows. This announcement comes just days after the alleged 2024 line-up was revealed in a leaked email. Dean, who will follow in the footsteps of Adam Peaty who competed on the series in 2021, will be announced on social media. However, fans may question whether this constitutes a rule break due to the BBC's method of announcing participants in their own way.

However, he credits his involvement under new manager Arne Slot and his performance in two pre-season games against Arsenal and Real Betis with boosting his confidence. He also expressed his desire to be a starting centre-back for Liverpool and expressed his appreciation for the recognition he received around England.

articles.title: There’s nothing weird about calling Trump weird
articles.description: When it comes to Trump and Vance, "weird" is a word that's accessible, snarky, and absolutely true.
articles.content: “Listen to the guy. He’s talking about Hannibal Lecter and shocking sharks and whatever crazy thing pops into his mind,” Walz said on CNN . “I thought we gave him too much credit. One of the things is... [4977 symbols]

keywords.name: former Republican president George W. Bush

articles.summary: The term "weird" has become a political buzzword of the moment, coined by Minnesota Governor Tim Walz and Senator JD Vance of Ohio, who are vying to be Vice President Kamala Harris' running mate to be President-nominated for the upcoming Vice President elections. The word was coined by former Republican president George W. Bush after Donald Trump's first day as president, during which he delivered the most dystopian inaugural address ever. The use of the word 'weird' is seen as a sign of resistance to the criticism of Donald Trump, who has previously been labelled as authoritarian, racist, a threat to democracy, a liar, and a convicted felon. However, the term has been revived for this political moment as a counterpunch to "woke," which remains intact unlike Republicans' dog-whistle perversion of the term.

articles.summary: Israeli swimmer Andi Murez is starting a residency program in psychiatry at the Mayo Clinic in Minnesota after completing her third Olympics. She plans to work on a project to improve national teams' mental health. Her goal is to implement a mental health program for all of Israel's national teams, given the Middle East crisis and the need for this comes after the war. Mureez plans to also translate an International Olympic Committe mental health survey into Hebrew. She has been balancing medical school and professional swimming back home, graduating from Tel Aviv University in 2023 after taking a break from courses to train for the delayed Tokyo Olympics.

articles.summary: Israeli swimmer Andi Murez is embarking on a project to improve national teams' mental health. Her goal is to help implement a mental health program for all of Israel's national teams, given the Middle East crisis and the need for such a program after the war. She plans to include annual mental health checks with athletes yearly physicals, and to translate an International Olympic Committe mental health survey into Hebrew. Despite her dual medical school and Olympic career, Murezz has found balance between her studies and professional swimming. She is set to compete in the 4x100-meter mixed medley relay preliminary heats of the Paris Games.

articles.title: Australian aid worker died as a result of Israeli 'failures'
articles.description: Serious errors combined with confirmation bias, led Israel to launch an airstrike on a humanitarian convoy that killed an Australian aid worker and six colleagues, government advice has found.
articles.content:
Serious errors led Israel to launch an airstrike on a humanitarian convoy that killed an Australian aid worker and six colleagues, government advice has found.

The Israeli Defence Force launched stri... [3755 symbols]

keywords.name: former Australian Defence Force chief Mark Binskin

articles.summary: The Israeli Defence Force launched an airstrike on a humanitarian convoy that killed an Australian aid worker and six colleagues from World Central Kitchen (WCK) in Gaza in early April, killing Australian Zomi Frankcom and six others. The Australian government found that serious errors led to the airstrike, including a lack of Israeli Defence Forces procedures, mistaken identification, and errors in decision-making. Former Australian Defence Force chief Mark Binskin served as special adviser to the government on Israel's response to the incident, stating that the strike was not deliberately directed towards the WCK. The deaths were the result of serious failures to follow Israeli defence Force procedures and a misidentification compounded by confirmation bias. Two Israeli officers have been removed and three reprimanded, but Frankcom's family has called for a criminal investigation. Foreign Affairs Minister Penny Wong stated that Israel will implement all recommendations and reiterated calls for a ceasefire in Gaza.

articles.summary: Heavy rain has fallen through the roof of Roland Garros at the Paris Olympics, a legendary tennis venue. The retractable roof was supposed to be on during the evening's competition but it appeared to have multiple areas that allowed water to pass. This was exacerbated by a large storm over the stadium, which exposed the leaks. Footage emerged on social media showing the heavy rain coming into the arena and fans trying to cover themselves. The Eiffel Tower Stadium was evacuated due to heavy rain, and the Eiffle Tower Stadium in Paris was evacuated.
